The Right Hon'ble the Governor in Council has the gratification ot publish ing for general information the following Notification, issued on the 23r(l ultimo, by order of the Most Noble the Governor General of India in Council, announc ing the Capture of Martaban and Rangoon by the British Forces now employed in Burmah. A Salute of 21 Guns will be fired at every Principal Military Station in this Presidency, on receipt of this Notification. Bu Order of the R'ujht Hon hie the Governor in Council, H. E. GOLDSMID, Secretary to Government. Bombay Castle, Srd May 18o2. NOTIFICATION. Friday, April 23rJ 185'2. The Governor General in Council has the highest satisfaction in announcing that Despatches have this day been received, reporting the Capture of Martaban and ot Rangoon, by combined attacks of the Naval and Military Forces now employed in Burmah. The Governor General in Council is pleased to direct, that in honour of this success, a Royal Salute shall be fired at every Principal Station in India. The Despatches will be published for general information. (Signed) C. ALLEN, Offg. Secy, to the Govt, of India. (True copy) H. E. GOLDSMID, Secretary to Government. A Salute of 21 Guns will be fired at every Principal Military Station in this Presidency, on receipt of this Notification. By Girder of the Right Hon ble the Governor in Council, H. E. The Governor General in Council has the highest satisfaction in announcing that Despatches have this day been received, reporting the Capture of Martaban and of Rangoon, by combined attacks of the Naval and Military Forces now employed in Burmah. The Governor General in Council is pleased to direct, that in honour of this success, a Royal Salute shall be fired at every Principal Station in India. The Despatches will be published for general information. (Signed) C. ALLEN, Offg. Secy, to the Govt, of India. (True copy) H. E. GOLDSMID, Secretary to Government. JBomhay Castle, Srd May 1852. NOTIFICATION. Friday, April 23rd ]85'2. The Governor General in Council has the highest satisfaction in announcing that Despatches have this day been received, reporting the Capture of Martaban and of Rangoon, by combined attacks of the Naval and Military Forces now employed in Burmah. The Governor General in Council is pleased to direct, that in honour of this success, a Royal Salute shall be fired at every Principal Station in India. The Despatches will be published for general information. (Signed) C. ALLEN, Offg. Secy, to the Govt, ot India. (True copy) H. E. GOLDSMID, Secretary to Government.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: The gazette is conveying news of the capture of Martaban [Mottama, Myanmar] and Rangoon by British forces in Burmah [Myanmar]. It therefore instructs a Royal Salute to be carried out at each Military station in the Bombay Presidency.The item contains three copies of this notification.
